intro: Gouania retinaria, commonly known as the red-stemmed gouania, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and appear in late spring to early summer. Gouania retinaria is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
